conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine the motion of objects A and B.
The image shows a velocity-time graph with two parabolic curves representing objects A and B.
Both curves start at the origin and rise, reaching their peaks at time t1.
The curve for object A is higher than that of object B, indicating different velocities.
The vertical distance between the two curves represents the difference in speed.
Both objects A and B move in the same direction along a straight line.
The vertical axis represents velocity and the horizontal axis represents time.
Both objects start from rest and accelerate to reach their maximum velocities at t1.
The difference in speed is represented by the vertical distance between the curves.
At t = 0, the difference in speed is minimal as both curves start close together.
As time progresses towards t1, the vertical distance between the curves increases.
After reaching maximum velocities at t1, the difference in speed remains constant.
The difference in speed between the two objects continuously increases from the start to t1.
